description: Led a team of four in the design, architecture, and implementation of a feature aimed at reducing system downtime caused by failed disks. This involved collaborating with appropriate stakeholders to identify business requirements and adhering to RAID best practices and storage principles.

Spearheaded the design, architecture, and implementation of a feature that significantly optimizes the addition of disks to memory space, thereby preventing downsizing and minimizing wasted space on physical disks thereby increasing storage capacity by 50%.

Collaborated with the development team to identify critical RAID processes and their dependencies, ensuring comprehensive test coverage for essential functionalities, and the reliability and resilience of the RAID subsystem
Engineered a disk configuration optimizer for ONTAP System Manager that provides real-time recommendations for RAID layouts based on workload analysis.
Delivered end-to-end implementation, including backend APIs (Python/C++), SQL-based data persistence, automated testing frameworks, and frontend integration, therby increasing efficiency by 5%.
Contributed to NetApp's distributed storage platform serving enterprise customers with petabyte-scale storage requirements.
Assisted in CS 540 (Introduction to AI) and CS 354 (C Programming and Computer Systems) courses.
Led review sessions, office hours, and developed practice problems for over 500 students.
